src_text: Kabinete e kopane ka Union Buildings ka Pretoria Merero ka seemong sa bjale Ka ge re keteka Kgwedi ya Basadi, Kabinete e lakalet a Mohumagadi Getrude Shope gore a fole ge a keteka let at i la gagwe la matswalo la go fet a mengwaga ye 92.
trg_text: Cabinet met at the Union Buildings in Pretoria Issues in the environment As we celebrate Women's Month, Cabinet wishes Ms Getrude Shope well in her 92th birthda MmaShope, as she is affectionately known, is a doyen of the struggle for liberation and for women emancipation in particula She is a recipient of Isithwalandwe/Seaparankwe, the highest honour awarded by the African National Congress to those who made an outstanding contribution and sacrifice to the liberation strugglCabinet also extended its well wishes to Ms Zondeni Veronica Sobukwe on her 90th birthda South Africa is a better country through the sacrifices played by women of her ilAs the country celebrates Women's Month under the theme

src_text: MmaShope, ka ge a tsebja bjalo ke bao ba mo ratago, ke molwelatokologo yo a hlomphegago ebile o lwet e kudukudu tokollo ya basad O amoget e sefoka sa Isithwalandwe/Seaparankwe, e lego sefoka sa tlhompho sa maemo a godimodimo seo se fiwago ke African National Congress go bao ba bilego le seabe se segolo le go itima t e nt i ba lwela tokologKabinete e lebi a gape mahlatse le mahlogonolo go Mohumagadi Zondeni Veronica Sobukwe ge a keteka let at i la gagwe la matswalo la go fet a mengwaga ye 90.
trg_text: Cabinet thanks the former Governor of the South African Reserve Bank, Mr Tito Mboweni, for his professionalism and dedication during the two-year period that he served as a non-executive director of the BRICS ND National Treasury Director-General, Mr Dondo Mogajane, will take oveSocial cohesio Cabinet condemns recent acts of racism by some individuals in our societ Such behaviour goes against the ethos of our constitutional rights, responsibilities and values, and has no place in our democratic societCabinet commends the management of private companies that deal swiftly with racism, indicating that racism is a scourge in society, and has to always be fought in the quest to entrench social cohesion and heal the pains of the pas

trg_text: in The Presidenc South Africans across the board have worked very well to participate in this commemoratio Government s progressive policies continue to prioritise the empowerment of women, particularly those living in rural areas, who often bear the harsh realities of povert As we celebrate the progress we have made in the emancipation of women, Cabinet reminds the country of one of the woman anti-apartheid activists who was killed on this day in 1982.

src_text: la OR Tambo, re keteka tema yeo e kgathilwego ke basadi bjalo ka baetapele ba lesolo la basadi ka mo nageng, re lemoga gore ge o maatlafat a mosadi, o maatlafat a set habBjalo ka basadi re fihlelet e t e nt i ka lefapheng la maatlafat o ya basad Pele ga 1994 Palamente e be e na le fela kemedi ya basadi ya 2,7%, gomme ka morago ga dikgetho t a mathomo t a temokrasi, kemedi ya basadi ka go Kopanokgothekgothe ya Maloko a Palamente e bile go 27,7%.
trg_text: statement, we commemorate the role of women as pioneers of the women's movement in this country, recognising that when you empower a woman, you empower the natioAs a country we have achieved a lot in the field of women empowermen Prior to 1994 Parliament had a mere 2,7% representation of women, and following the first democratic elections, women representation in the National Assembly stood at 27,7%.

src_text: Ka 1999 dipalopalo t eo di ile t a hlatloga go ba 30% gomme ka morago ga fao t a ba go 32,7% ka 2004.
trg_text: In 1999 that figure increased to 30% and then to 32,7% in 2004.

src_text: Ka morago ga dikgetho t a boset haba t a 2009 kemedi ya basadi e fihlile go 42%.
trg_text: After the 2009 national elections women representation reached 42%.

src_text: Ditona t a Basadi bjalo di bopilwe ke 43% ya KabinetRe na le basadi ba bant i bao ba lego maemong a boetapele gomme makala a mmu o a gare a kaonafat a maemo a basad Mo lebakeng le re na le Kantoro ya Tona ya Basadi ka Kantorong ya Mopresident MaAfrika Borwa go ralala le makala ka moka a
trg_text: Women Ministries now comprise 43% of the CabineWe have many women in leadership positions and government structures are in place to improve the status of wome We now have the Ministry of Women

src_text: omile gabotse go kgatha tema ka mo ketekong y Melawana ya mmu o ya kgatelopele e t wela pele go bea pele maatlafat o ya basadi, kudukudu bao ba dulago dinagamagaeng, bao gant i ba itemogelago seemo se boima sa bohlok Ge re dut e re keteka kgatelopele yeo re e dirilego ka go lokolleng ga basadi, Kabinete e gopot a naga ka ga yo mongwe wa basadi bao ba lwet ego tokologo yo a ilego a bolawa ka la 17 Phato 1982.
trg_text: Upcoming events Cabinet reiterates President Zuma s call, reminding members of the public to nominate persons from all walks of life deserving to receive the country s highest honours, the National Orders, in April next yeaThe ceremony honours South Africans and eminent foreign nationals who have excelled in various fieldNominations forms are available on The Presidency s website (wwthepresidencgoza), Thusong Service Centres, municipal offices and constituency office A short motivation of the person nominated should be attache The 2018 National Orders nominations will close on 31 August 2012.

src_text: Ruth First o ile a bolawa sehlogo ka pomo ya lengwalo leo a bego a romet we lona ka Mozambiqu O ile a lefa ka setopo ge a be a sa tekateke go lwela tokologo ya batho ba Afrika BorwDikgaruru t a go Amana le Bong (GBV) Kabinete e tsent e maikutlo a yona ka kgalemong ya seswant ho sa bidio seo se bego se bont ha mosetsana wa sekolo a hlaselwa ke mo emane wa sekolo ka sekolong sa KwaZulu-Natal gomme e amogela go golegwa ga mogononelwa yo Polao ye e sa t wago go hlaga ya moruti i wa sekolo yo a thunt wego pele ga barutwana ba gagwe ke molekane wa gagwe e re gopot a ka ga ditlhohlo t a tlai o ya basadi t eo re sa lebanego le t on Dikwe obohloko le dikotsi t e di tli wago ke setlwaedi sa taolo ya banna go basadi t e di felet ago ka dikgaruru kgahlanong le basadi le bana di swanet e go lwant hwa ke rena ka moka bjalo ka set hab Ditheo t a tiri o ya molao le tshepedi o ya toka go bosenyi di swanet e go t eela bao ba dirago ditiro t e magatSeboka sa Mokgatlo wa Dinaga t e di Hlabologago t a Borwa bja Afrika (SADC) Afrika Borwa, bjalo ka modulasetulo yo moswa wa SADC, ke monggae wa Seboka sa Mehleng SADC sa bo 37 sa Dihlogo t a Dinaga le t a Mebu o go tloga ka la 9 go fihla ka la 20 Phato 2017 ka fase ga morero wa
trg_text: Ruth First was brutally killed by a letter bomb sent to her in Mozambiqu She paid the ultimate sacrifice in her relentless pursuit of freedom for the people of South Afric Cabinet has added its voice to the condemnation of a video showing a schoolgirl being attacked by a male pupil at a school in KwaZulu-Natal and welcomes the arrest of the suspec The recent killing of a school teacher shot in front of her pupils by her partner reminds us of the challenges we still face of the abuse of womeGender-based violence The harms and dangers of patriarchy which result in the violence against women and children should be fought by all of us as a societ The law-enforcement agencies and the criminal justice system must deal decisively against the perpetratorSADC Summit South Africa, as incoming chair of the Southern African Development Community (SADC), is hosting the 37th Ordinary SADC Summit of Heads of State and Government from 9 to 20 August 2017 under the theme:

trg_text: Partnering with the Private Sector in Developing Industry and Regional Value Chains .South Africa will use its position to strategically advance the country s national interests as outlined in the National Development Plan (NDP), drive regional and continental industrialisation and integration to boost the implementation of Africa Agenda 2063 of the African Union (AU).

trg_text: Cabinet also joined the AU in congratulating Kenya for conducting successful election It is now incumbent on all citizens in Kenya to accept the results of the elections and to work towards national unity in the countrBRICS President Zuma will today, 17 August 2017, preside over the official launch of the African Regional Centre of the Brazil, Russia,India, China and South Africa (BRICS) New Development Bank (NDB) at the Michelangelo Hotel, Sandto The launch of the African Regional Centre will showcase the NDB s service offering, highlighting the bank s potential role in the area of infrastructure and sustainable development in emerging and developing countrie.

src_text: Lenaneo la 2063 ke tlhako ya togamaano ya pheto o ya ekonomi ya set haba ya ka khonthinenteng ye mo mengwageng ye e tlago ye 50.
trg_text: Agenda 2063 is the strategic framework for the socio-economic transformation of the continent over the next 50 year It builds on and seeks to accelerate the implementation of past and existing continental initiatives for growth and sustainable developmenThree potential growth paths, namely agro-processing, mineral beneficiation and downstream processing value chains, have been identifieThe summit will also pay tribute to the outgoing President Jos

trg_text: South Africa is among the BRICS member countries that adopted a Seven-Point Action Plan focused on expanding industrial cooperation, at a BRICS Industry Ministers meeting held in Hangzhou, Chin These countries will further cooperate in fields such as the development of new industrial infrastructure, technology development and innovation, and small and medium-sized enterprise.

trg_text: Cabinet was briefed on a number requests to redetermine the provincial boundaries from communities in various province Amongst the areas affected are Elias Motsoaledi Local Municipality, Marblehall Local Municipality and Matatiele Local MunicipalitThese communities have cited a number of reasons for these requests, such as the geographic location and access to service The requests were received by the Municipal Demarcation Board and Department of Corporative Governanc Provincial boundaries are provided for in the Constitutio Any consideration of such requests should be done within the constitutional frameworCabinet agreed that a process to redetermine the boundaries, which include Matatiele, be institute This parliamentary process will also include public participation as required by the Constitution and the la

src_text: Eduardo dos Santos wa Angola, yo a tla bego a fologa setulo ka morago ga mengwaga ye 37 e le Mopresidente gomme a etile pele naga ya gabo go t wa ka ntweng ya bana ba thar Motlat amopresidente Ramaphosa, ka maemo a gagwe bjalo ka Mokgokaganyi wa SADC ka Nageng ya Kgo i ya Lesotho, le yena o tla ala pego go Seboka sa SADC sa Double Troika seo se tlogo swarwa ka Pretoria ka la 18 Phato, fao Mmu o wa Lesotho le ona go emet wego gore o tla ala peakanyo ya diphetogo t a ka nageng ye Se se tla ka morago ga ditheri ano gareng ga Motlat amopresidente le mmu o o moswa, le baetapele ba mekgatlo ya kganet o, sehlopha sa dikgo i le bakgathatema ba set haba ka Nageng yeo, e le ge ba reri ana ka ga lenaneo la phethagat o ka botlalo ya diphetho t a SADC mabapi le dipheto o t a molaotheo le t a lefapha la t hirelet
trg_text: Eduardo dos Santos of Angola, who will be stepping down after 37 years as President and leading his country out of a protracted civil wa Deputy President Ramaphosa, in his capacity as the SADC Facilitator to the Kingdom of Lesotho, will also table a report to the SADC Double Troika Summit taking place in Pretoria on 18 August, where the Lesotho Government is also expected to table a reforms roadma This follows the consultations between the Deputy President with the new government, leaders of opposition parties, the college of chiefs and civil society stakeholders in the Kingdom, charting the path for the full implementation of SADC decisions on constitutional and security sector reform Cabinet welcomes the outcomes from President Jacob Zuma hosting President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of the Republic of Liberia, during a State Visi Both countries agreed to look into improving an enabling environment to ease the manner of doing business in our respective countrie Cabinet encourages more private sector companies to invest in LiberiThe parties also agreed to finalise the signing of a Visa Waiver Agreement for Holders of Diplomatic and Official Passport They also agreed to speed up discussions and finalisation of other bilateral instruments on agriculture, tourism, health, energy water and sanitation amongst other Cabinet congratulates the people of Rwanda on the holding of a peaceful election that saw the re-election of President Paul Kagam The conclusion of yet another successful poll in Africa is a clear indication that democratic advances continue across the continen.

src_text: Kabinete e amogela dipoelo go t wa go kamogelo ya Mopresidente Jacob Zuma go Mopresidente Ellen Johnson Sirleaf wa Repabliki ya Liberia, ka nakong ya ketelo ya Semmu o ka mo nagen Dinaga t e ka bobedi di dumelelane ka go lebeledi i a go kaonafat a seemo seo se kgont hago go nolofat a mokgwa wa go dira kgwebo ka dinageng t a ren Kabinete e hlohlelet a dikhamphani t e nt i t a phraebete go beelet a ka LiberiDipresidente t e ka bobedi di dumelelane ka go felelet a go saenela Tumelelano ya Go Etela Dinageng t e ka Bobedi ka ntle le Visa go bao ba nago le Diphasepote t a Setiplomate le t a Semmu
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the commitment by the Canadian Government to cooperate with South Africa in border managemen This came after the Minister of Home Affairs, Prof Hlengiwe Mkhize, met with her Canadian counterpart Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizen Mr Ahmed Hussen this wee This exchange will further strengthen the existing relationship between the two countries Cabinet decisions Cabinet approved the Mandate Paper for the 2018 Budge This will further drive the implementation of the ND The paper strengthens the alignment of the budget to the Medium Term Strategic Framewor It establishes a systematic basis for making choices among competing priorities within limited resource The Minister in The Presidency, Mr Jeff Radebe, will hold a media briefing at a later stag Cabinet approved the Coastal and Marine Tourism Implementation Plan, developed under the auspices of the Operation Phakisa Oceans Econom The plan will uplift tourism in the ocean econom It will grow a world-class and sustainable coastal and marine tourism destination that leverages South Africa s competitive advantages in nature, culture and heritag The Minister of Tourism, Ms Tokozile Xasa, will hold a separate media briefing to unpack this pla Cabinet approved South Africa s participation in the Second International Indian Ocean Expedition for 2017

src_text: Ba dumelelane gape ka go akgofi a dipoledi ano le go felelet a ditumelelano t e dingwe t a dinaga t e ka bobedi mabapi le temo, boeti, maphelo, enet i, meetse le kelelat hila gareng ga t e dingw Kabinete e lebogi a badudi ba Rwanda ge ba swere dikgetho t a khut o t eo go t ona go kgethilwego leswa Mopresidente Paul Kagam Go phethwa ga dikgetho t e dingwe t eo di atlegilego ka Afrika ke taet o ya pepeneneng ya gore dikgatelopele t a temokrasi di a t wela pele go ralala le khonthinetent.
trg_text: support South Africa s Chairpersonship of the Indian Ocean Rim Association in 2017/18.South Africa will use its research vessel SA Agulhas II to conduct marine research while training and building scientific capacity for South Africa and East AfricThe gathering of basic long-term environmental data and information will place the developing countries of the Indian Ocean Rim in a better position to conserve the integrity of its ocean and to find ways to unlock their respective potential ocean economies to improve the lives of their citizen Cabinet was apprised on the Chemicals and Waste Economy Phakisa Labs initiative, which is scheduled to commence in August 2017.

trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the court decision that reaffirmed the prerogative of the government to make policy decisions and directives by dismissing with costs an application by the Metal Recyclers Association of South Afric The Constitutional Court dismissed an application by local exporters of scrap metal for leave to appeal the judgement of the High Court of South Africa and the Supreme Court of AppeaThe Court has upheld the State s scrap metal export provisions known as price-preference for domestic foundries, mini-mills and secondary smelters scrap meta It provides for a price discounted by 20% to international prices before qualifying for an export permi This policy will help to reindustrialise the country s economy and create job.

trg_text: Cabinet thanks the members the Fifth National House of Traditional Leaders (NHTL) whose terms come to an en The NHTL is a body composed of traditional leaders who are delegates from the provincial houses of traditional Leaders of South Africa, representing the provincial houses at national leve The group comprised of both outgoing members of the NHTL and members who have been re-elected to serve for one more ter They represent traditional leadership and their communities and promote the role of traditional leadership within the constitutional dispensatioCabinet joined President Zuma in thanking Kgosi PP Maubane (Chairperson), Ikosi SE Mahlangu (Deputy Chairperson) and the entire membership of the Hous Cabinet extends a warm welcome to the in-coming members of the Sixth NHTL and those of the seven provincial houses Messages Cabinet congratulates Ms Senamile Masango who became the first African woman to conduct the first African-led experiment at the European Organisation for Nuclear Research laboratory in Switzerlan She was part of a group of student researchers from the University of the Western Cape studying the isotope selenium-70 to better understand how its nuclei shape relates to its energy level Cabinet congratulates People Opposing Women Abuse (POWA), who have developed an App that helps survivors of gender-based violence, in distress or imminent danger, to have access to integrated and coordinated service With a link to the Department of Social Development s Command Centre, the App can link to other services like the police and social workers, who can be able to identify the location where the message originateThrough a press of a panic button on the mobile, a victim will be linked to the Command Centr This collaboration between government and non-governmental organisations will go a long way towards fighting the scourge of abus Cabinet congratulates Team South Africa for their outstanding achievements on the track and field at the International Association of Athletics Federations World Championships in LondoCaster Semenya won gold in the 800m and bronze in the women s 1 500m, in the process breaking her personal best recor Semenya has done the country proud and amidst the negativity, she remains strong and resilien She follows in the footsteps of Zola Budd, Natalie du Toit, the paralympian, and Penny Heyns, the swimme Wayde van Niekerk won gold in the men s 400m and silver in the 200 A special word of gratitude to the coach, Ms Anna Both Luvo Manyonga won gold medal with his leap of m in the men s long-jump final, Ruswahl Samaai won bronze in the men s long jump, and Akani Simbine came fifth-place in the men s 100m finaTheir performances showcased the sporting prowess of our nation, which is an inspiration and motivation to all South Africans, especially young budding athleteThese athletes did our nation proud and carried our national flag with distinctio We call on South Africans to continue supporting all our national teams, as well as our sportsmen and wome They are an embodiment of our great nation, and we have no doubt that they will inspire other young people to follow in their footsteps AppointmentsAll appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearanc Mr AD Matseke as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Broadband Infraco, with effect from 1 September 2017 to 30 August 2022.

src_text: Kabinete e amoget e boikgafo bjo bo dirilwego ke Mmu o wa Canada bja go diri ana le Afrika Borwa ka taolong ya mellwan Se se tlile ka morago ga ge Tona ya Merero ya Selegae, Moprofesara Hlengiwe Mkhize, a kopane le modiri ani ka yena wa Canada e lego Tona ya t a Bofaladi, Badudi ba Dinaga t a ka ntle le Badudi ba ka nageng Morena Ahmed Hussen mo bekeng y Neelano ye e tla t wela pele go maatlafat a kamano ye e lego gona gareng ga dinaga t e ka bobedi Diphetho t a Kabinete Kabinete e dumelet e Sengwalwathomelo sa Ditekanyet o t a 2018.
trg_text: Extension of the fixed-term contract of the current CEO of Broadband Infraco, Ms PV Kwele, by three months, from 1 September to 30 November 2013.

src_text: Se se tla t wela pele go tsenya tiri ong ND Sengwalwa se se maatlafat a go nyalelanya ditekanyet o le Tlhako ya Togamaano ya Lebaka la Magaren Se hloma motheo wa tshepedi o wa go dira dikgetho gareng ga ditlhokwa t eo di tlago pele t e di phenkgi anago ka go diri a methopo ye e sa lekaneg Tona ya Kantorong ya Mopresidente, Morena Jeff Radebe, o tla swara kopano le baga i ba ditaba ka moragonyan Kabinete e dumelet e Leanophethagat o la Boeti bja Mabopong a Lewatle le bja ka Lewatleng, leo le hlamilwego ka fase ga tshepedi o ya Ekonomi ya Mawatleng ya Operation Phakis Leano le le tla thekga boeti ka ekonoming ya mawatlen Le tla godi a lefelo la boeti bja mabopong a lewatle le bja ka lewatleng la maemo a godimo lefaseng ka bophara le la go ya go ile leo le

src_text: omi ago kudu menyetla ya bokgoni ya Afrika Borwa mabapi le tlhago, set o le bohw Tona ya Boeti, Mohumagadi Tokozile Xasa, o tla sedimo a baga i ba ditaba ka ga leano l Kabinete e dumelet e go kgatha tema ga Afrika Borwa ka go Pont ho ya Mawatle ya Bobedi ya Bodit habat haba ya 2017

src_text: Go kgatha tema mo go tla thekga Bodulasetulo bja Afrika Borwa bja Mokgatlo wa Lebopo la Lewatle la India ka 2017/18.Afrika Borwa e tla

src_text: omi a sekepe sa yona sa dinyaki i o seo se bit wago SA Agulhas II go dira dinyaki i o t a ka lewatleng mola ka go le lengwe se hlahla le go agela Afrika Borwa le seboka sa dinaga t a bohlabela bja Afrika bokgoni bja t a mahlalGo kgoboket wa mo ga datha le tshedimo o ya motheo ya lebaka le letelele ka ga tikologo go tla bea dinaga t e di hlabologago t a Lebopo la Lewatle le India maemong a makaone a go lota seriti sa lewatle la t ona le go hwet a mekgwa ya go utolla bokgoni bja t ona bja ekonomi ya mawatle ka nepo ya go kaonafat a maphelo a badudi ba t on Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga lesolo la Ekonomi ya Dikhemikhale le ya Dilahlwa la Phakisa Labs, leo le rulagant wego gore le tla thomi wa ka Phato 2017.

src_text: Se se bopa karolo ya tsenogare ya naga ye go laola dit ho et o go tikologo le go maphelo a batho t eo di bakwago ke dikhemikhale le dilahlwLe tla fana ka sebaka se sengwe go intasteri ya dikhemikhale ya Afrika Borwa gore e tsebe mebaraka ya t welet o yeo e amant hwago le Khemistri ye e nago le segwera go Tikologo (go hlama ga dit welet wa t a dikhemikhale le ditshepedi o t e di fokot ago goba di tlo ago t welet o ya dilo t e kotsi).

src_text: Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga dikgopelo t e mmalwa t a go bea leswa mellwane ya diprofense go t wa metseng ka diprofenseng t a mehutahut Gareng ga mafelo ao a amegilego ke Masepala wa Selegae wa Elias Motsoaled, Masepala wa Selegae wa Marblehall le Masepala wa Selegae wa MatatielDit haba t e di file mabaka a mmalwa ao a dirilego gore go be le dikgopelo t e, a go swana le fao lefelo le lego gona le phihlelelo ya ditirel Dikgopelo di amoget we ke Lekgotla la Karoganyo ya Mellwane le Kgoro ya Tiri ano ya Makala a Mmu o le Merero ya Set o (COGTA).Mellwane ya diprofense e hlagi it we ka gare ga Molaothe Sephetho sefe goba sefe mabapi le dikgopelo t a mohuta wo se swanet e go t ewa go lebelet we ditlhagi o t a molaotheKabinete e dumet e gore tshepedi o ya go bea mellwane leswa, yeo e akaret ago Matatiele, e thomi w Tshepedi o ye ya palamente le yona e tla akaret a go kgatha tema ga set haba ka ge go nyakwa ke Molaotheo le molao Ditiragalo t e di tlago Kabinete e bu elet a boipilet o bja Mopresidente Zuma bjo bo gopot ago maloko a set haba go
